content.text: Learn how to create a filter list with JavaScript.
content.html: Learn how to create a filter list with JavaScript.

content.text: How to use JavaScript to search for items in a list.
content.html: How to use JavaScript to search for items in a list.

<ul id="myUL">
  <li><a href="#">Adele</a></li>
  <li><a href="#">Agnes</a></li>

  <li><a href="#">Billy</a></li>
  <li><a href="#">Bob</a></li>

</ul>

content.text: Note: We use href="#" in this demo since we do not have a page to link it to. In real life this should be a real URL to a specific page.
content.html: Note: We use href="#" in this demo since we do not have a page to link it to. In real life this should be a real URL to a specific page.

content.code_html:
#myInput {
  background-image: url('/css/searchicon.png'); /* Add a search icon to input */
  background-position: 10px 12px; /* Position the search icon */
  background-repeat: no-repeat; /* Do not repeat the icon image */
  width: 100%; /* Full-width */
  font-size: 16px; /* Increase font-size */
  padding: 12px 20px 12px 40px; /* Add some padding */
  border: 1px solid #ddd; /* Add a grey border */
  margin-bottom: 12px; /* Add some space below the input */
}

#myUL {
  /* Remove default list styling */
  list-style-type: none;
  padding: 0;
  margin: 0;
}

#myUL li a {
  border: 1px solid #ddd; /* Add a border to all links */
  margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent double borders */
  background-color: #f6f6f6; /* Grey background color */
  padding: 12px; /* Add some padding */
  text-decoration: none; /* Remove default text underline */
  font-size: 18px; /* Increase the font-size */
  color: black; /* Add a black text color */
  display: block; /* Make it into a block element to fill the whole list */
}

#myUL li a:hover:not(.header) {
  background-color: #eee; /* Add a hover effect to all links, except for headers */
}

syntaxHighlighting.text:
// Loop through all 
list items, and hide those who don't match the search query

content.code:
<script>function myFunction() {  // Declare variables
var input, filter,
ul, li, a, i, txtValue;  input = document.getElementById('myInput');
filter = input.value.toUpperCase();  ul =
document.getElementById("myUL");  li =
ul.getElementsByTagName('li');  // Loop through all
list items, and hide those who don't match the search query  for (i = 0; i <
li.length; i++) {    a = li[i].getElementsByTagName("a")[0];

txtValue = a.textContent || a.innerText;
if (txtValue.toUpperCase().indexOf(filter) > -1) {
li[i].style.display = "";    }
else {
li[i].style.display = "none";
}  }}
</script>

syntax_highlighting.text:
// Loop through all 
list items, and hide those who don't match the search query

content.code_html:
<script>
function myFunction() {
  // Declare variables
   var input, filter, ul, li, a, i, txtValue;
  input = document.getElementById('myInput');
  filter = input.value.toUpperCase();
  ul = document.getElementById("myUL");
  li = ul.getElementsByTagName('li');

  // Loop through all list items, and hide those who don't match the search query
  for (i = 0; i < li.length; i++) {
    a = li[i].getElementsByTagName("a")[0];
    txtValue = a.textContent || a.innerText;
    if (txtValue.toUpperCase().indexOf(filter) > -1) {
      li[i].style.display = "";
    } else {
      li[i].style.display = "none";
    }
  }
}
</script>

syntax_highlighting_data.text:
// Loop through all 
list items, and hide those who don't match the search query

content.text: Tip: Remove toUpperCase() if you want to perform a case-sensitive search.
content.html: Tip: Remove toUpperCase() if you want to perform a case-sensitive search.

content.text: Tip: Also check out Filter Table .
